meanings.definition: A person who resells tickets for events at a price higher than the face value.
meanings.sent1: The scalpers outside the concert venue were selling tickets at inflated prices.
meanings.sent2: The scalpers made a profit by selling tickets for the game at a higher cost.
meanings.sent3: The scalpers tried to make a quick buck by selling tickets for the show.
meanings.sent4: The scalpers were like opportunistic hawks swooping in on the event tickets.
meanings.sent5: Beware of scalpers selling overpriced tickets outside the stadium.

meanings.definition: To resell tickets for events at a price higher than the face value.
meanings.sent1: Some people scalpers tickets to make extra money.
meanings.sent2: He decided to scalpers the concert tickets he had bought.
meanings.sent3: She tried to scalpers the theater tickets but couldn't find buyers.
meanings.sent4: The friends scalpers the extra tickets among themselves.
meanings.sent5: Scalpersing tickets is against the rules of the event organizers.
